Files

SF_mainmodule.php

This file is Siteframework's main module !!!Important!!! this module should never output anything itself when in production Note: Shouldn't need to change values in here, default settings for SF in: 1) SF_mainconfig.php - for SF directory paths etc 2) SF_localconfig.php - intended to be the file changed on a per installation/host basis 3) SF_config_site.csv (csv text file) for defining site and subsite 'config_dir' files 4) SF_config_dir.csv (csv text file) for per directory configuration (menu, css, header, footer) 5) SF_config_menu.csv (csv text file) for menu configuration data

CHANGELOG in SF_changelog.md

SF_PageInitialise()  : mixed
This (based on the page which called it) initialises everything for Siteframework It calls: SF_LoadSiteConfigData() (which determines file for SF_LoadDirConfigData()) SF_LoadDirConfigData() (which determines menudata, css, header and footer to load) SF_LoadMenuData() to initialise everything for this page (menu wise) Also

SF_GenerateBreadCrumbLine()  : mixed
Output breadcrumb html for current page CSS styles are: SF_breadcrumbarea, SF_breadcrumb_line, SF_breadcrumb_title and SF_breadcrumb_item
SF_GetPageTitle()  : mixed
returns a string representing the current page Argument is following types: GPT_PAGE = Current Page Title (as determined via menu data) GPT_SITEnPAGE = $SFsitetitle + Current Page Title GPT_BREADCRUMB = current breadcrumb (as determined via menu data) line separated by '|'s GPT_SITE+BREADCRUMB = $SFsitetitle + current breadcrumb

Returns CSS path and file name based on 'config_dir' settings

SF_LoadSiteConfigData()

SF_mainmodule.php : 93

Gets the config_dir filename

SF_LoadSiteConfigData() : mixed

Load the SF_config_site.csv file and based on our current path extracts the appropriate config_dir filename. Result loaded into global array $siteconfigarray

Return values
mixed —

SF_LoadDirConfigData()

SF_mainmodule.php : 184

Gets the settings for menu, css, header and footer files

SF_LoadDirConfigData() : mixed

Load the dir_config file (determined by SF_LoadSiteConfigData()) and based on our current path extracts the appropriate config_menu, css , header and footer filenames.

Return values
mixed —

SF_LoadMenuData()

SF_mainmodule.php : 328

Loads the menu data for the page we are on

SF_LoadMenuData() : mixed

Load the menu_config file (determined by SF_LoadDirConfigData()) and based on our current path figure out what menu item we are on. Popoulates two globals arrays; $menudataarray (contains the whole menu data file) and contains a sort sorted list of current menu items to display

Return values
mixed —

Ouput the HTML for the current menu

SF_GenerateNavigationMenu([mixed $menuhighlight = true ][, mixed $dooffsitelinktags = true ], mixed $showonlylevel[, mixed $separator = '' ]) : mixed

Use global array $currentmenuarray to ouput the currently selected menu set as was determined by SF_LoadMenuData(). Menu block is surrounded by a

Menu level 1's are tagged as

Menu level 2's are tagged as

SF_GenerateBreadCrumbLine()

SF_mainmodule.php : 562

Output breadcrumb html for current page CSS styles are: SF_breadcrumbarea, SF_breadcrumb_line, SF_breadcrumb_title and SF_breadcrumb_item

SF_GenerateBreadCrumbLine([string $breadcrumbleadtext = 'You are in: ' ][, string $breadcrumbseparator = ' > ' ][, bool $output = true ][, mixed $displayhome = true ][, mixed $limitchars = 200 ]) : mixed
Parameters
$breadcrumbleadtext : string = 'You are in: '

the lead text for the breadcrumbline

$breadcrumbseparator : string = ' > '

the separator between each breadcrumb item

$output : bool = true

output (true) html or return result from function as string (false)

$displayhome : mixed = true
$limitchars : mixed = 200
Return values
mixed —

SF_GenerateContentFromURL()

SF_mainmodule.php : 867

Gets the contents of named file/URL and output it.

SF_GenerateContentFromURL(mixed $url[, mixed $returncontents = false ]) : mixed

Passed a filename/URL it determines to: http:// just get it anything else assume some sort of relative path so convert it to an absolute file reference starting at webserver DOCUMENT_ROOT so these should all be ok: file.html (reference in current dir) ../about/index.html (some sort of relative reference) /about/index.html (absolute reference (from root) on this server)

Parameters
$url : mixed
$returncontents : mixed = false
Return values
mixed —

SF_GeneratefromMarkdownURL()

SF_mainmodule.php : 918

Gets the MARKDOWN contents and FRONT MATTER named file/URL and output it.

SF_GeneratefromMarkdownURL(mixed $url[, mixed $title = true ][, mixed $summaryonly = false ][, mixed $returncontents = false ]) : mixed

Passed a filename/URL it determines to: http:// just get it anything else assume some sort of relative path so convert it to an absolute file reference starting at webserver DOCUMENT_ROOT so these should all be ok: file.md (reference in current dir) ../about/index.md (some sort of relative reference) /about/index.md (absolute reference (from root) on this server)

Parameters
$url : mixed
$title : mixed = true
$summaryonly : mixed = false
$returncontents : mixed = false
Return values
mixed —
